title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Heyson> has joined #xwiki  
00:40 <Heyson> hey there  
00:40 <Heyson> somebody available for a little help for a newbie?  
00:45 <Denis> has quit  
00:57 <Heyson> =(  
00:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
01:00 <Heyson> Hello Slashman  
01:02 <rafaelav> has joined #xwiki  
01:02 <rafaelav> has left #xwiki  
01:45 <sdumitriu> Hey Heyson  
01:45 <sdumitriu> What's your problem?  
02:03 <Heyson> I'm trying to make a form in order to create a new Object in my wiki. I'd like to know how to do it. I'm trying $obj.display("key","edit") but the input returned have a numbered id based on the number of instances of this object previously created so I can't know what id to fetch when reading the post =(  
02:07 <sdumitriu> Heyson: Can you wait a bit? I'm having dinner  
02:08 <Heyson> Sure  
02:23 <Slashman> has quit  
02:45 <Heyson> has quit

12:54 <North> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <North> has left #xwiki  
15:57 <Ankatern> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <Ankatern> has quit  
16:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
17:00 <Addev> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <Addev> Hello  
17:03 <sdumitriu> Hi Addev  
17:03 <Addev> I have a little question maybe you can help me ;)  
17:04 <Addev> I want to put a button in a wiki page, and show a Javascript alert when clicked  
17:04 <Addev> but if I put <script> blocks in a {{html}} form xwiki scape them  
17:04 <Addev> how can I do it?  
17:07 <sdumitriu> {{html clean="false"}}  
17:10 <Addev> {{html clean="false"}} <script> function myFunction() { alert("I am an alert box!"); } </script>  <input type="button" onclick="myFunction()" value="Show alert box"> sdasdasda {{/html}}  
17:10 <Addev> I'm testing this code but it only works in edit mode =(  
18:11 <Addev> has quit  
19:11 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
19:54 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
20:06 <Xwiki> has joined #xwiki  
20:06 <Xwiki> Hello  
20:07 <Xwiki> has quit  
20:07 <apprentice> has joined #xwiki  
20:07 <apprentice> hello  
20:07 <apprentice> I have a little (and fast) problem  
20:07 <apprentice> some1 can help me?  
20:08 <sdumitriu> Hi apprentice  
20:08 <sdumitriu> Go on  
20:08 <apprentice> I'm learning this engine and I'm a little noob XD  
20:08 <apprentice> but it is a great wiki engine ^^  
20:09 <apprentice> I'm trying to create a object inside a wiki page  
20:09 <apprentice> and edit its attributes editing the page  
20:09 <ekarlso> what do you guys use for mailinglists ?  
20:09 <apprentice> so I created a class "Test.Message"  
20:10 <apprentice> with a single attribute: "text" (type=string)  
20:10 <apprentice> then in my wiki page I put this text:  
20:10 <apprentice> #set($mobj=$doc.getObject("Tests.Message",true)) $mobj.display("text",$context.action)<p/>  
20:11 <apprentice> But nothing is saved when I change the input and save the page  
20:11 <apprentice> what am I doing wrong?  
20:25 <sdumitriu> $doc.getObject(classname, force) will look for an existing object, and if none is found, one is created temporarily  
20:25 <sdumitriu> The object isn't saved  
20:25 <sdumitriu> Did you follow the FAQ tutorial?  
20:25 <sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/FAQTutorial  
20:26 <sdumitriu> The second one is using the manual method, you should look into that if you want to learn how to code in XWiki  
20:26 <apprentice> Ok I'll check tanks!  
20:26 <sdumitriu> The first one is using WYSIWYG tools to let the platform create an application for you  
20:27 <apprentice> hmm sounds like the second option is what I need  
20:27 <apprentice> thanks  
20:33 <sdumitriu> ekarlso: WDYM? We use mailman for our mailing lists (devs, users, etc.)  
20:34 <ekarlso> WDYM ?  
20:39 <sdumitriu> What Do You Mean?  
20:40 <sburjan> sdumitriu, : did you got my PM ?  
20:40 <sdumitriu> Yes  
20:41 <sburjan> ok  
20:43 <ekarlso> ok  
21:00 <sdumitriu> has quit  
21:01 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
22:01 <Denis> has quit  
22:15 <apprentice> hello sdumitriu are you there?  
22:16 <sdumitriu> Yes  
22:16 <apprentice> I've check the FAQ tutorial  
22:16 <apprentice> but doesn't match my needs  
22:17 <apprentice> I need to make a form to edit the objects in a page, but allowing the users to reorder the elements inside the form  
22:17 <apprentice> (all the users will be programmers so there is no problem)  
22:17 <apprentice> is that possible?  
22:22 <vmassol> has quit  
22:23 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
22:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:42 <vmassol> has quit  
22:45 <apprentice> still there?
